sufian.video.server

Class RTSPServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • sufian.video.server.RTSPServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable

    public class RTSPServer
extends Object
implements Runnable
    A simple implementation of an RTSP Server. The server can receive an RTP video stream and redirect it to the receiver. The server runs on a separate thread.The RTSP communication is implemented using simple TCP connection. It responds to six RTSP commands: OPTIONS, DESCRIBE, SETUP, PLAY, PAUSE, TEARDOWN.

    The supported video codecs are H.263 and H.264. The server generates the SDP according to the specified codec and some information obtained from the stream.

    Author:
    Sufian Latif
    See Also:
    RFC 2326 for more datails on RTSP.

    • Field Detail

      • TAG

        private static final String TAG
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEBUG

        private static final boolean DEBUG
        Set this to true to get Log messages from this class.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • server

        private ServerSocket server
        ServerSocket to run the RTSP server. The default port for RTSP is 554, but if that is unavailable, 8554 is used as alternative port. But any port can be used here.

      • client

        private Socket client
        The Socket created by accepting a client.

      • clientIP

        private String clientIP
        IP address of the client. It should be the localhost (127.0.0.1).

      • pipe

        private VideoPipe pipe
        The VideoPipe for redirecting video.

      • running

        private boolean running
        The server keeps running while this is true

      • encoder

        private RTSPServer.Encoder encoder
        The encoder of the RTP stream. The VideoPipe is instantiated depending on this value.

      • sessionID

        private String sessionID
        A randomly generated string used as RTSP session ID.

      • rtpPort

        private int rtpPort
        A UDP port to receive the RTP stream. The VideoPipe is created on this port.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RTSPServer

        public RTSPServer(int port,
          int rtp,
          String enc)
           throws IOException,
                  SocketException
        Constructor for the RTSP server. It creates a TCP ServerSocket to listen for RTSP requests.
        Parameters:
        port - The port to listen for the RTSP client requests
        rtp - The port to receive RTP stream from sender
        enc - The encoding of RTP stream
        Throws:
        IOException - If an error occurs while creating the socket
        SocketException - When the VideoPipe cannot be created

    • Method Detail

      • createSDP

        private String createSDP()
        Creates the SDP (Session Description Protocol) string for passing to VideoView. Uses a common format similar to the SDP strings generated by VLC media player. Both the source and destination addresses are set to localhost (127.0.0.1).

        After the common header, the media attributes are added according to the video codec.

        Returns:
        A string containing the SDP
        See Also:
        RFC 4566 for details on SDP

      • randomString

        public String randomString()
        Generates a random string of 20 decimal digits. The strings are used as RTSP session identifier and session version in the SDP.
        Returns:
        A string of 20 random decimal digits

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the thread on which the server is running.

      • run

        public void run()
        Overridden run method.

        This method's workflow:

        1. Waits for the VideoPipe to be ready for forwarding RTP packets.
        2. Accepts the only client and creates TCP connection.
        3. Receives requests from client, generates response and sends them until server is closed.
        Specified by:
        run in interface Runnable

      • processRequest

        private RTSPResponse processRequest(RTSPRequest request)
        Parses an RTSPRequest and generates an RTSPResponse to send back to client.
        Parameters:
        request - an RTSPRequest from the client
        Returns:
        an RTSPResponse containing the reply
